greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of the digital sums of n for all the bases 2 to n (a 'digital-sum factorial').
comment: Definition changed to run from bases 2 to n instead of 1 to n, in order to reflect the sequence numbers, correctly. - suggested by _Michel Marcus_ and changed by the author, Jul 19 2013
link: Hieronymus Fischer, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
formula: a(n) = Product_{p=2..n} ds_p(n) where ds_p = digital sum base p.
[Both formulas corrected in accordance with the changed definition by the author; Jul 19 2013]
mathematica: Table[Times @@ Map[Total@ IntegerDigits[n, #] &, Range[2, n]], {n, 24}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 03 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {p = n; for (b=2, n, digs = digits(n, b); p *= sum(k=1, #digs, digs[k]););return (p);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 15 2013
results.author: _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jul 05 2007
